Transcription for 547499

Mistletoe hung from the gas brackets in all of the front parlors.
There were sherry and walnuts and bottled beer and crackers by the dessert screens.
And cats in their furabouts watched the fires.
And the high-heaped fire spat, all ready for the chestnuts and the mulling pokers.
Some few large men sat in the front parlors without their collars.
Uncles almost certainly trying their new cigars, holding them out judiciously at arm's length,
returning them to their mouths, coughing, then holding them out again as though waiting for an explosion.
And some few small aunts, not wanted in the kitchen, not anywhere else for that matter,
sat on the very edges of their chairs, poised and brittle, afraid to break like faded cups and saucers.
